content.p: These self-contained resources offer guided learning on particular themes. They are based around full-size digital images of original documents. Each resource also includes commentaries and supporting material. The resources are suitable for A-level, further and higher education students and lifelong learners. Two of the resources have been used as the basis for Schools Resources suitable for Key Stage 3 and GCSE students. Find out more about our free Heritage Learning Programme for Key Stage 1 and 2 here View the resource >> William III's invasion of England in 1688, the 1745 Jacobite Rebellion, and the American War of Independence Slum housing, water supplies and sewerage, disease and death in mid-19 th century Nottingham Laxton - the one place which has retained the medieval 'open field' system of farming Three themes from the ‘Age of Reform’: The 1846 South Nottinghamshire Election, Working Class Unrest, and Catholic emancipation The online texts on this site allow researchers to study four different versions of D H Lawrence's Odour of Chrysanthemums Women in our medieval collections: extracts from stories, works of instruction, religious books and legal documents Next page: Introduction to the Conflict Learning resource Kings Meadow Campus Lenton Lane Nottingham, NG7 2NR telephone: +44 (0) 115 951 4565 fax: +44 (0) 115 846 8651 email: mss-library@nottingham.ac.uk
